revised_title: Terrestrial Epidemiology and the Role of Extraterrestrial Pathogens
tldr: The author discusses the patterns of infectious diseases and evaluates the hypothesis that extraterrestrial recruitment from space, specifically cometary tails, contributes to the terrestrial population of pathogenic bacteria and viruses. The author argues that known facts and patterns in disease transmission suggest that the application of Occam's razor is more appropriate than invoking extraterrestrial recruitment to explain the spread of infectious diseases.
